text:
Oh my God! I am so miserable! Why didn’t I know you before? Why didn’t you come sooner? Oh, dear! 

“I’m here now.” 

“Yes, but what do we do now? Together, together!” she said without thinking, hugging him again. “I’ll follow you to Siberia!” 

He pulled back, and a proud smile appeared on his face. 

“Maybe I don’t want to go to Siberia yet, Sonia,” he said. 

Sonia looked at him quickly. After feeling so much sympathy for him, the awful thought of the murder hit her hard. She felt confused. She didn’t know why or how it happened. A lot of questions flooded her mind. She couldn’t believe it: “He is a murderer! Is that really true?” 

“What does this mean? Where am I?” she said, completely confused, still trying to understand. “How could you, someone like you… How could you do this? What does it mean?” 

“Oh, well—to steal. Please stop, Sonia,” he replied tiredly, almost annoyed. 

Sonia stood there, speechless, but then suddenly exclaimed: “You were hungry! It was… to help your mother? Right?” 

“No, Sonia, no,” he muttered, turning away.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia expresses her anguish and disbelief upon realizing that Raskolnikov is a murderer, struggling to reconcile her feelings for him with the horror of his actions.
